member.name: T:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.DAC.Obligation.periodKey
member.summary: The ID code for the period that this obligation belongs to. The format is a string of four alphanumeric characters. Occasionally the format includes the # symbol. For example: 18AD, 18A1, #001

member.name: T:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.DAC.Obligation.start
member.summary: The start date of this obligation period Date in the format YYYY-MM-DD For example: 2017-01-25

member.name: T:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.DAC.Obligation.end
member.summary: The end date of this obligation period Date in the format YYYY-MM-DD For example: 2017-01-25

member.name: T:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.DAC.Obligation.due
member.summary: The due date for this obligation period, in the format YYYY-MM-DD. For example: 2017-01-25. The due date for monthly/quarterly obligations is one month and seven days from the end date. The due date for Payment On Account customers is the last working day of the month after the end date. For example if the end date is 2018-02-28, the due date is 2018-03-29 (because the 31 March is a Saturday and the 30 March is Good Friday).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.DAC.Obligation.status
member.summary: Which obligation statuses to return (O = Open, F = Fulfilled) For example: F

member.name: T:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.DAC.Obligation.received
member.summary: The obligation received date, is returned when status is (F = Fulfilled) Date in the format YYYY-MM-DD For example: 2017-01-25

member.name: T:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.DAC.ObligationStatus
member.summary: Allowed obligation statuses

member.name: T:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.DAC.ObligationStatus.ListAttribute
member.summary: List attribute of the obligation status.

member.summary: Fulfilled obligation status

member.summary: The due date for this obligation period, in the format YYYY-MM-DD. For example: 2017-01-25. The due date for monthly/quarterly obligations is one month and seven days from the end date. The due date for Payment On Account customers is the last working day of the month after the end date. For example if the end date is 2018-02-28, the due date is 2018-03-29 (because the 31 March is a Saturday and the 30 March is Good Friday).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.DAC.VATPeriodFilter.status
member.summary: Which obligation statuses to return (O = Open, F = Fulfilled) For example: F

member.summary: Exception returned by the VAT API when sending or viewing the return or retrieve obligations.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Exceptions.VATAPIInvalidToken
member.summary: Exceptions returned by VAT API when the token is invalid.

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.REFRESH_TOKEN_IS_INVALID
member.summary: Refresh Token is missing

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.REFRESH_TOKEN_IS_MISSING
member.summary: Refresh Token is missing

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.VRN_INVALID
member.summary: The provided VRN is invalid

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.PERIOD_KEY_INVALID
member.summary: Invalid period key

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.INVALID_REQUEST
member.summary: Invalid request

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.VAT_TOTAL_VALUE
member.summary: totalVatDue should be equal to the sum of vatDueSales and vatDueAcquisitions

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.VAT_NET_VALUE
member.summary: netVatDue should be the difference between the largest and the smallest values among totalVatDue and vatReclaimedCurrPeriod

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.INVALID_NUMERIC_VALUE
member.summary: please provide a numeric field

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.INVALID_MONETARY_AMOUNT
member.summary: 1. amounts should be a non-negative number less than 9999999999999.99 with up to 2 decimal places 2. The value must be between -9999999999999 and 9999999999999 3. amount should be a monetary value (to 2 decimal places), between 0 and 99999999999.99

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.MISSING_CREDENTIALS
member.summary: No OAuth token supplied for user-restricted or application-restricted endpoint

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.INVALID_CREDENTIALS
member.summary: Invalid OAuth token supplied for user-restricted or application-restricted endpoint (including expired token)

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.UNAUTHORIZED
member.summary: Supplied OAuth token not authorised to access data for given tax identifier(s)

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.INCORRECT_ACCESS_TOKEN_TYPE
member.summary: User-restricted API is being accessed with a server token

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.HTTPS_REQUIRED
member.summary: Request done with HTTP

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.RESOURCE_FORBIDDEN
member.summary: The OAuth token's application is not subscribed to the API

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.INVALID_SCOPE
member.summary: The scope of the OAuth token is not sufficient to access the API

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.CLIENT_OR_AGENT_NOT_AUTHORISED
member.summary: The client and/or agent is not authorised.

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.DATE_RANGE_TOO_LARGE
member.summary: The date of the requested return cannot be more than four years from the current date

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.NOT_FINALISED
member.summary: User has not declared VAT return as final

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.DUPLICATE_SUBMISSION
member.summary: User has already submitted a VAT return for the given period

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.TAX_PERIOD_NOT_ENDED
member.summary: Return submitted too early

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.MATCHING_RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND
member.summary: No endpoint could be found in the API for the request path

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.NOT_FOUND
member.summary: The remote endpoint has indicated that no associated data is found

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.HTTP_NOT_FOUND
member.summary: No API could be found for the context

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
member.summary: Internal server error

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.NOT_IMPLEMENTED
member.summary: API not implemented/deployed

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.SERVER_ERROR
member.summary: Service unavailable

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.SCHEDULED_MAINTENANCE
member.summary: Scheduled maintenance

member.name: F:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Error.GATEWAY_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Request timed out

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Obligation.end
member.summary: The end date of this obligation period Date in the format YYYY-MM-DD For example: 2017-01-25

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Obligation.due
member.summary: The due date for this obligation period, in the format YYYY-MM-DD. For example: 2017-01-25. The due date for monthly/quarterly obligations is one month and seven days from the end date. The due date for Payment On Account customers is the last working day of the month after the end date. For example if the end date is 2018-02-28, the due date is 2018-03-29 (because the 31 March is a Saturday and the 30 March is Good Friday).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Obligation.status
member.summary: Which obligation statuses to return (O = Open, F = Fulfilled) For example: F

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.Obligation.periodKey
member.summary: The ID code for the period that this obligation belongs to. The format is a string of four alphanumeric characters. Occasionally the format includes the # symbol. For example: 18AD, 18A1, #001

members.member: The obligation received date, is returned when status is (F = Fulfilled) Date in the format YYYY-MM-DD For example: 2017-01-25 ///

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.ObligationsRequest.from
member.summary: Date from which to return obligations. Mandatory unless the status is O. For example: 2017-01-25

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.ObligationsRequest.to
member.summary: Date to which to return obligations. Mandatory unless the status is O. For example: 2017-01-25

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.ObligationsRequest.status
member.summary: Which obligation statuses to return (O=Open, F=Fulfilled) For example: F

member.name: T:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.RequestAuthorisation
member.summary: Authorisation

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.RequestAuthorisation.vrn
member.summary: VAT registration number. A nine-digit number. For example: 123456789

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.RequestAuthorisation.serverToken
member.summary: Server token of Head of HTTP request Example: Authorization - Bearer 70fc461f8c82d2a322cfe87066ffb284

member.name: T:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VATreturn
member.summary: Submit VAT return for period

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VATreturn.periodKey
member.summary: The ID code for the period that this obligation belongs to. The format is a string of four alphanumeric characters. Occasionally the format includes the # symbol. For example: 18AD, 18A1, #001

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VATreturn.vatDueSales
member.summary: VAT due on sales and other outputs. This corresponds to box 1 on the VAT Return form. The value must be between -9999999999999.99 and 9999999999999.99.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VATreturn.vatDueAcquisitions
member.summary: VAT due on acquisitions from other EC Member States. This corresponds to box 2 on the VAT Return form. The value must be between -9999999999999.99 and 9999999999999.99.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VATreturn.totalVatDue
member.summary: Total VAT due (the sum of vatDueSales and vatDueAcquisitions). This corresponds to box 3 on the VAT Return form. The value must be between -9999999999999.99 and 9999999999999.99.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VATreturn.vatReclaimedCurrPeriod
member.summary: VAT reclaimed on purchases and other inputs (including acquisitions from the EC). This corresponds to box 4 on the VAT Return form. The value must be between -9999999999999.99 and 9999999999999.99.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VATreturn.netVatDue
member.summary: The difference between totalVatDue and vatReclaimedCurrPeriod. This corresponds to box 5 on the VAT Return form. The value must be between 0.00 and 99999999999.99

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VATreturn.totalValueSalesExVAT
member.summary: Total value of sales and all other outputs excluding any VAT. This corresponds to box 6 on the VAT Return form. The value must be between -9999999999999 and 9999999999999.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VATreturn.totalValuePurchasesExVAT
member.summary: Total value of purchases and all other inputs excluding any VAT (including exempt purchases). This corresponds to box 7 on the VAT Return form. The value must be between -9999999999999 and 9999999999999.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VATreturn.totalValueGoodsSuppliedExVAT
member.summary: Total value of all supplies of goods and related costs, excluding any VAT, to other EC member states. This corresponds to box 8 on the VAT Return form. The value must be between -9999999999999 and 9999999999999.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VATreturn.totalAcquisitionsExVAT
member.summary: Total value of acquisitions of goods and related costs excluding any VAT, from other EC member states. This corresponds to box 9 on the VAT Return form. The value must be between -9999999999999 and 9999999999999.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VATreturn.finalised
member.summary: Declaration that the user has finalised their VAT return. For example: true

member.name: T:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VaTreturnResponse
member.summary: HTTP status: 201 (Created)

members.member: The time that the message was processed in the system. ///

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VaTreturnResponse.paymentIndicator
member.summary: Unique number that represents the form bundle. The system stores VAT Return data in forms, which are held in a unique form bundle. Must conform to the regular expression ^[0-9]{12}$

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VaTreturnResponse.formBundleNumber
member.summary: Is DD if the netVatDue value is a debit and HMRC holds a Direct Debit Instruction for the client. Is BANK if the netVatDue value is a credit and HMRC holds the client's bank data. Otherwise not present. Limited to the following possible values: DD BANK

member.name: P:PX.Objects.Localizations.GB.HMRC.Model.VaTreturnResponse.chargeRefNumber
member.summary: The charge reference number is returned, only if the netVatDue value is a debit. Between 1 and 16 characters.
